answers.answer: I went into sever preeclampsia whenI was 38 wks but was put on bed rest at 35 weeks. it's very scary and can get bad very fast. nobody told me the feeling of heartburn that won't go away was a big danger sign. try to lay on your left side as much as you can. it helps lower your blood pressure. good luck prayers are with you!

Thanks and my doc said its I'm early stage and i was admitted to the hospital thus pray weekend...but even on left side my blood pressure ire still high but all i can do is pray and bc now my whole pregnancy was great and I'm a FTM

I developed it at the end of my first pregnancy was 38 weeks they induced me the next week.I unfortunately am showing signs of it again but this time I am only 23 weeks!Pre-eclampsia is a scary thing....it's so unstable....The degree of it can change in minutes!Just make sure if you feel the slightest thing change....even if it's just a unsettling feeling or worry...Contact your doctor right away! Dealing with this is one of those situations in pregnancy where you can be that over freak out mode!Praying you and baby have a healthy delivery!

I have been dealing with Gestational hypertension since 28 weeks and was put on meds and have had the meds upped twice now. I'm currently 35 weeks 5 days and my BP is out of control. I am going twice a week and she said she was probably going to up my meds again on Thursday. At this point she is  just really trying to get me to 37 weeks without things going wrong. My bp on 90mlg of meds was 158 yesterday and she was not happy. Just got up and can't sleep head is pounding BP is 143 and going up. I have been fine with it till this past week now I'm stressing something is going to happen :-(

Hopefully you are able to make it a few more weeks... 37 weeks is considered full term... your baby would still be fine it you needed to be induced though... my aunt had to deliver her 7th baby after battling severe preeclampsia at 24 weeks.... my aunt was in the hospital for 2 weeks and my cousin was in the NICU for 3 months... I remember my aunt was tripping out because she had her baby home and she was a few months old and it was before her due date.. your doctors will monitor you and make sure that you and your baby are both healthy... I know that I am at risk for preeclampsia-- I had chronic hypertension that went away at about 24 weeks so I was taken off my medication but my doctor reiterates that I may have to go back on it if my blood pressure spikes... so far it has been good-- thank god but im still being closely monitored because I have gestational diabetes. .. so having that plus the preexisting high blood pressure puts me at a higher risk. I'm 33 weeks and just hoping that is one piece of bad news that I don't get... she needs to stay put for 4 more weeks

I had problems with my pressure before the baby and as the pregnancy progress my pressure regulated, i asked is that normal, she said that it does happen, but towards the end that could all change, but just today I started experiencing swelling in my feet hands. Went to work and my co worker said that I look a little swollen in the face as well. So I can only imagine what the doc will tell me friday when I got back. I hope its nothing, but I also hope u can make it to ur 38th week, but if u can't 35 weeks is not that bad. Baby is already 85-90% prepared to exit and meet the world!

question: Well my doc said I'm in the early stages of preclaimsia and i go to the doc twice a week now..i go back thurs to check her weight, fluid..my blood pressure is high and i got to much swelling in my feet, hands the must i go is 38w and today I'm 35w(bc its after12am) but if my blood pressure still not down then they will induced me so that me and my princess will be healthy...but I'm just praying!!!!
title: Anybody else experience preclaimsia(however you spell it)!!!!
